attributes.action: Fund free parking at hospitals for all healthcare students on placements
attributes.additional_details:
For example, some trainee staff working full time at a hospital during placement, for which they don't get paid, and then have to pay £30.00 per week to park. Over a 7-week placement parking will cost them £210.00
 
I think this is absolutely disgusting and should not be allowed to continue.
attributes.background: I want the Government to fund free parking at Hospitals for trainee Doctors and Nurses. Many trainee Doctors and Nurses are having to pay parking charges whilst on placement at Hospitals during their training period.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

other_parliamentary_business.body:
The MPs on the Petitions Committee have scheduled a debate on three petitions:
Ensure student nurses are paid for placement hours (https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610557)
Extend 30 hours free childcare to student midwives/nurses/paramedics (https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616557)
Minimum wage pay for all healthcare students for placement hours worked! (https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619609)
Marsha de Cordova MP, a member of the Committee, will open the debate, which will take place on Monday 11 September. 
Share your views
To inform the debate, we would like to hear from you about your experiences and views on pay and financial support for healthcare students.
You can share your views with us by completing this survey: https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=nt3mHDeziEC-Xo277ASzSpMLsAawCSdBvMh9cdt5o9ZURTFYREk3MlNGTEhFNDE4OEczODlTWUVBNC4u
The survey will close on Tuesday 29 August at 10am.
Your responses will be anonymous. A summary of responses will be published on the Parliament website. It will also be shared with MPs and may be referred to in the debate or within other parliamentary documents. Please don't share anything that may identify you. 
Watch the debate
The debate will take place on Monday 11 September at 4.30pm.
Watch the debate (https://youtube.com/live/CNhlZhOeLAE?feature=share)
Read a transcript of the debate (https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2023-09-11) (available a few hours after the debate happens)
What are petition debates?
Petition debates are ‘general’ debates which allow MPs from all parties to discuss the important issues raised by one or more petitions, and put their concerns to Government Ministers.
Petition debates don’t end with a vote to implement the request of a petition. This means that MPs will not vote on the requests of the petitions at the end of the debate.  
Get involved in the work of the UK Parliament
Sign up to the Your UK Parliament newsletter (https://parliament.us16.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=3ad7e4c57a864f07e4db008c4&id=26d0645ea9) for the latest information on how to get involved and make a difference.
other_parliamentary_business.subject: Share your views on pay and financial support for healthcare students
